pages.title: 19 ▪ The Sun ▪ ר
pages.text: Lord of the Fire of the World

The Sun coming out from the walled garden; the sunflowers turn to follow it in its journey back home.$(br)  A naked child sits on their red cape, symbolizing the destiny of the Holy Source and the great light which goes before the endless procession of humanity.$(br)  The card signifies, therefore, the transit from the manifest light of this world, represented by the glorious sun of earth, to the light of the world to come, which goes

before aspiration and is typified by the heart of a child.$(br)  The Sun is that of consciousness in the spirit - the direct as opposed to the reflected light of the Moon.$(br)  The characteristic type of humanity has become an innocent child therein - a child in the sense of simplicity, and innocence in the sense of wisdom.$(br)  In that simplicity, they bear the seal of Nature and of Art; in that innocence, they signify

the restored world.$(br)  When the Self-Knowing Spirit has dawned in the consciousness above the natural mind, that mind in its renewal leads forth the instinct in perfect ease.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Joy, simplicity, confidence, innocence.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  We may have to look for hidden joy, as if clouds have partly covered the sun.
